thread.title: Marriott Vacation Club buys Australian resort
thread.title_full: Marriott Vacation Club buys Australian resort

author: Cindy Barth
title: Marriott Vacation Club buys Australian resort
text:
Thinkstock Orlando-based Marriott Vacation Club, a global leader in vacation ownership, has boughtâ€¦ more Orlando-based Marriott Vacation Club , a global leader in vacation ownership, has bought the Surfers Paradise Marriott Resort & Spa in Australia in a deal valued at about $90 million, Hotel Management reports . The 329-room hotel completed a $20 million renovation in 2011, and includes 14 conference and event areas, as well as a saltwater swimming lagoon. The sale is being handled by McVay Real Estate. Marriott Vacation Club has a portfolio of 54 resorts and more than 12,100 timeshare villas throughout the U.S., Caribbean, Europe and Asia.
